name: Shogi Sanmai
overview: A shogi game with a twist. Added to standard shogi modes for players wishing to compete against a CPU opponent, the game features an alternative mode with multiple "instance puzzles" where the player is given a limited number of pieces with which to checkmate their opponent. Each of these instances sets up the board in a specific way, giving the player specific pieces to place. The game title cames from ¨Samadhi¨ a yoga/Hindu/Buddhist term referring to a state of focus through meditative trance who could have been inspired the free mode included.
